chapters.title: 第一章：上学的第一天
chapters.text:
我叫爱琪。今天是星期四，是我来这个学校上学的第一天。这个学校里的学生不多。在这个学校上学的学生们，都要住在学校里边，我也一样。在上课的时候，老师请我到前边介绍我的名字和爱好。

爱琪：“同学们，早上好！我的名字叫爱琪，你们叫我小爱也行。我喜欢唱歌，也喜欢看电影。我不喜欢读书。很高兴认识你们！我想要和你们做好朋友！”

我还想再介绍一些我的事：我的家在……我常常去的商场是……我最喜欢吃的东西是……

这些，我都不记得了。

来这个学校前的事，我都不记得了！

en_sentences.en: My name is Aiqi.
Today is Thursday, and it's my first day studying at this school.
There aren't many students at this school.
All the students who study here live at the school, and I do too.
During class, the teacher asked me to go to the front to introduce my name and hobbies.
Aiqi: “Good morning, classmates!”
My name is Aiqi; you can call me Xiao Ai too.
I like singing, and I also like watching movies.
I don't like studying.
Nice to meet you!
I want to be friends with you all!
I also wanted to introduce more about myself—where my home is, the mall I often go to, and what food I like most... but I don't remember any of it.
I don't remember anything from before I came to this school!

chapters.title: 第二章：第一个朋友
chapters.text:
下课后，有一个女生和我说话。她说她的名字是诗启，两个多月前来到了这个学校。她喜欢看电影，喜欢听歌，还喜欢唱歌。她说她想和我做朋友。我们有一样的爱好，我也喜欢她。诗启是我在学校里认识的第一个好朋友。

学校里的事，我都和诗启一起做。早饭、午饭、晚饭，我们两个人都在一起吃。上课的时候，我们坐在一起；下课的时候，我们一起玩儿。晚上睡觉前，我们会一起唱喜欢的歌。能和诗启做朋友，我真的很高兴！

en_sentences.en: After class, a girl talked to me.
She said her name is Shiqi, and she came to this school more than two months ago.
She likes watching movies, listening to songs, and singing.
She said she wants to be friends with me.
We have the same hobbies, and I like her too.
Shiqi is the first good friend I met at this school.
At school, I do things together with Shiqi.
For breakfast, lunch, and dinner, the two of us eat together.
In class we sit together; after class we play together.
Before going to sleep at night, we sing songs we like together.
Being friends with Shiqi makes me really happy!

chapters.title: 第三章：不能做的事
chapters.text:
我们一个星期要上五天的课，从星期一到星期五。在星期六和星期日的时候，我们休息，不用上课。

在不用上课的这些时间里，我很想和诗启一起出去玩儿。我知道，在学校的东边有一个电影院，我想和诗启一起去那里看电影。我还知道，在电影院的北边有一个饭店，我想和诗启一起去那里吃东西。这些都是我在学校里的地图上看到的地方。

我也知道，我们不能去。在学校里，有一些我们不能做的事：没有老师和我们一起的时候，我们就不能出学校。我们也不能用手机和电脑。

en_sentences.en: We have classes five days a week, from Monday to Friday.
On Saturdays and Sundays, we rest and don’t have class.
During this time with no classes, I really want to go out and have fun with Shiqi.
I know there is a movie theater on the east side of the school, and I want to go there with Shiqi to watch a movie.
I also know there is a restaurant north of the theater, and I want to go there with Shiqi to eat.
These are places I saw on the school map.
But I also know we can’t go.
At school, there are things we are not allowed to do: when no teacher is with us, we can’t leave the school.
We also can’t use phones or computers.

chapters.title: 第四章：“都很好”
chapters.text:
今天是星期六，老师说要带我们一起去商场买东西，我很高兴。诗启准备买一个新书包。我准备买一个新本子。

到了商场后，老师给了我们每个人一百元钱。我们能用这一百元钱，去买喜欢的东西。我和诗启在商场里一块儿买东西，我们先去买书包。诗启拿了一个书包就要买。

爱琪：“你先等一会儿再买！你怎么在商店门口，不进来呢？商店里边还有很多别的书包呢，你快进来！”

诗启：“好的。”

爱琪：“你看！这个书包也很好看。”

诗启：“好，我就买这个。”

爱琪：“你还没看呢……还有这个！这两个书包，你喜欢哪个？”

诗启：“我觉得都很好。”

爱琪：“……”

最后，诗启买了我觉得好看的那个书包。诗启常常觉得什么都很好，我和她不一样。我有喜欢的东西，也有不喜欢的东西。

在商场里，我还看到了两个人……

en_sentences.en: Today is Saturday. The teacher said he would take us to the mall to buy things, and I was very happy.
Shiqi planned to buy a new backpack.
I planned to buy a new notebook.
After we arrived at the mall, the teacher gave each of us 100 yuan.
We could use this 100 yuan to buy things we liked.
Shiqi and I shopped together in the mall, and first we went to buy a backpack.
Shiqi picked up a backpack and was about to buy it.
Aiqi: “Wait a moment before you buy!”
Why are you standing at the shop entrance and not coming in?
There are many other backpacks inside—come in quickly!”
Shiqi: “Okay.”
Aiqi: “Look!”
This backpack looks nice too.
Shiqi: “Okay, I’ll buy this one.”
Aiqi: “You haven’t even looked yet… and there’s this one too!”
Between these two backpacks, which one do you like?
Shiqi: “I think they’re both good.”
In the end, Shiqi bought the backpack that I thought looked good.
Shiqi often thinks everything is good, but I’m not the same as her.
There are things I like, and things I don’t like.
At the mall, I also saw two people…

chapters.title: 第五章：家人？
chapters.text:
在商场里，我看到了两个人。那是一个女人和一个小男孩儿，我听到了他们说的话。小男孩儿说：“妈妈，我想买这个书包。”那个女人回答：“好。”

听了小男孩儿的话，我想到了我的妈妈。我的妈妈是谁？她现在在哪儿？我都不记得了。我还有别的家人吗？我的家人在哪里？我也不知道。

我走到诗启的旁边。

爱琪：“诗启，你家有几口人？”

诗启：“我不知道。”

爱琪：“你的妈妈是谁？她现在在哪儿？”

诗启：“我也不知道。”

爱琪：“来这里上学前，你住在哪里？”

诗启：“我不记得了……”

诗启也不记得这些事，真的是太奇怪了！我们是生病了吗？怎么都不记得来学校前的事了？也都不记得我们的家人？

en_sentences.en: At the mall, I saw two people.
It was a woman and a little boy, and I heard what they said.
The little boy said, 'Mom, I want to buy this backpack.'
The woman replied, 'Okay.'
After hearing him, I thought of my mom.
Who is my mom?
Where is she now?
I don’t remember.
Do I have other family members?
Where is my family?
I don’t know either.
I walked over to Shiqi.
Aiqi: 'Shiqi, how many people are in your family?'
Shiqi: 'I don’t know.'
Aiqi: 'Who is your mom?'
Where is she now?
Shiqi: 'I don’t know either.'
Aiqi: 'Before you came here to study, where did you live?'
Shiqi: 'I don’t remember…' She doesn’t remember these things either—this is really too strange!
Are we sick?
How is it that we don’t remember anything from before coming to school?
And we don’t remember our families either?

chapters.title: 第六章：“对”
chapters.text:
我和诗启不住在一个房间里。今天下课后，我去了诗启的房间，和她一起学习。

爱琪：“诗启，你来这个学校几个月了？”

诗启：“到下个星期就三个月了。”

爱琪：“都快三个月了！我来这里还不到一个星期。我们学校有十个老师吧？诗启，你觉得哪个老师最好？”

诗启：“我觉得老师们都很好。”

爱琪：“我很喜欢我们的汉语老师，我觉得汉语老师比外语老师好。汉语课很好玩儿，有时候，老师会给我们放电影。外语课太难了，很多外语课本里的课文我都不会读。”

诗启：“对，那些课文太难了。”

爱琪：“你真的觉得难吗？上课的时候，我听见你都会读。你觉得我们的生活老师，王老师好不好？”

诗启：“他是个很好的人。”

爱琪：“我觉得他很凶。”

诗启：“对，他也很凶。”

诗启还是一样，常常用“不知道”和“对”……来回答我。

en_sentences.en: Shiqi and I don't live in the same room.
After class today, I went to Shiqi's room and studied with her.
Aiqi: 'Shiqi, how many months have you been at this school?'
Shiqi: 'By next week it will be three months.'
Aiqi: 'Almost three months!'
I've been here less than a week.
Our school has ten teachers, right?
Shiqi, which teacher do you think is the best?'
Shiqi: 'I think all the teachers are good.'
Aiqi: 'I really like our Chinese teacher.'
I think the Chinese teacher is better than the foreign-language teacher.
Chinese class is really fun.
Sometimes the teacher plays movies for us.
Foreign-language class is too hard; I can't read a lot of the texts in the foreign-language textbook.
Shiqi: 'Yes, those texts are too hard.'
Aiqi: 'Do you really think it's hard?'
In class, I heard you could read them all.
What do you think of our life teacher, Teacher Wang—good or not?'
Shiqi: 'He's a very good person.'
Aiqi: 'I think he's very strict.'
Shiqi: 'Yes, he's also very strict.'
Shiqi was still the same, often answering me with 'I don't know' and 'yes'...

chapters.title: 第七章：消失的朋友
chapters.text:
今天是星期二，诗启没有来上课。老师没有告诉我们诗启怎么了。我问别的同学诗启去哪儿了，他们也都说不知道。没有诗启的这一天，我做什么事都不高兴。

放学后，我马上去诗启的房间找她，想看看她是不是病了。我来到诗启的房间后，没有看到她。她的房间里很干净，床上什么东西都没有。她的书、衣服、杯子、书包……她的东西都没有了。诗启怎么了？她去哪儿了？她怎么没有告诉我就走了？她还会回来吗？

en_sentences.en: Today is Tuesday, and Shiqi didn't come to class.
The teacher didn't tell us what happened to Shiqi.
I asked other classmates where Shiqi went, but they all said they didn't know.
Without Shiqi, I wasn't happy doing anything that day.
After school, I immediately went to Shiqi's room to look for her, to see if she was sick.
When I got to her room, I didn't see her.
Her room was very clean, and there was nothing on the bed.
Her books, clothes, cup, backpack... all of her things were gone.
What happened to Shiqi?
Where did she go?
Why did she leave without telling me?
Will she come back?

chapters.title: 第八章：寻找她
chapters.text:
第二天，我一到学校就去找诗启。我去了教室、走廊、食堂，也去了她的房间，可是哪里都没有她。我问了老师，老师只说她今天不在，让我回去上课。

下课后，我又去问同学。有人说没见过她，有人说不记得这个名字。我心里很难受：昨天她还在，今天怎么就不见了？

晚上，我一个人坐在床上，想了很久。诗启真的来过吗？如果她来过，为什么大家都不记得？我决定继续找下去。

en_sentences.en: The next day, as soon as I arrived at school, I went to look for Shiqi.
I went to the classroom, the hallway, and the cafeteria, and I also went to her room, but she was nowhere.
I asked the teacher, and the teacher only said she wasn't here today and told me to go back to class.
After class, I went to ask other classmates again.
Some said they hadn't seen her; some said they didn't remember that name.
I felt awful: she was here yesterday—how could she be gone today?
At night, I sat on the bed alone and thought for a long time.
Did Shiqi really come here?
If she did, why doesn't everyone remember?
I decided to keep searching.

chapters.title: 第九章：变化
chapters.text:
没有诗启的日子，一切都不一样了。上课的时候，我总是看向她以前坐的地方。那个位子现在空着，好像从来没有人坐过。

我发现了一些小变化：她的名字不在名单上，她的床也不见了。就像她从来没有在这个学校生活过一样。

我开始怀疑自己：是不是我记错了？可是我还记得我们一起吃饭、一起唱歌。我知道，这些不是假的。

en_sentences.en: Without Shiqi, everything felt different.
During class, I always looked toward where she used to sit.
That seat is empty now, as if no one ever sat there.
I noticed some small changes: her name isn't on the list, and her bed is gone too.
It's as if she never lived at this school.
I started to doubt myself: did I remember wrong?
But I still remember us eating together and singing together.
I know this isn't fake.

chapters.title: 第十章：新朋友
chapters.text:
几天后，班里来了一个新学生。老师让她坐在诗启以前的位子上。她对我笑，说她刚来这个学校，什么都不熟。

下课时，她来和我说话，问我学校的事。她说她也不记得来这里以前的生活。

我一边和她聊天，一边想起诗启。她们不一样，可是有一点很像：她们都没有过去。我不知道该不该再交朋友，但我也不想再一个人。

en_sentences.en: A few days later, a new student came to our class.
The teacher had her sit in the seat Shiqi used to sit in.
She smiled at me and said she had just come to this school and wasn't familiar with anything.
After class, she came to talk to me and asked about the school.
She said she also didn't remember her life before coming here.
While I chatted with her, I kept thinking of Shiqi.
They are different, but there's one thing that's similar: neither of them has a past.
I don't know if I should make friends again, but I also don't want to be alone anymore.

chapters.title: 第十一章：我不知道
chapters.text:
新同学叫小文。她的眼睛很亮，说话也很轻。可是我问她什么，她常常回答：我不知道。

下课的时候，我和她一起去食堂。我问她，你来这个学校多久了。她说：我不知道。我又问她，你住在哪个房间。她还是说：我不知道。

我觉得奇怪：怎么会什么都不知道。我问她，来这里以前你记得什么吗。她想了想，摇摇头，说她不记得。

听到这些话，我心里一冷。诗启以前也常常这样回答我。难道在这个学校里，所有人都会慢慢变成这样吗？

en_sentences.en: The new classmate is called Xiaowen.
Her eyes are bright, and she speaks softly.
But no matter what I asked, she often answered: I don't know.
After class, I went to the cafeteria with her.
I asked her how long she had been at this school.
She said: I don't know.
I asked again which room she lived in.
She still said: I don't know.
I felt it was strange—how could she not know anything?
I asked what she remembered from before coming here.
She thought for a moment, shook her head, and said she didn't remember.
Hearing this, my heart went cold.
Shiqi used to answer me like this too.
In this school, will everyone slowly become like this?

chapters.title: 第一章：最努力的女孩
chapters.text: 丝雨刻苦努力，是最美也最聪明的女孩。她的男友小卡英勇帅气，猫咪Kiki又胖又黏人。三人互相照顾，学习、冒险、做饭、看星星，烦恼都会消失。他们笑着说，这就是他们的幸福“zoogether”。每天都充满温暖与希望。

chapters.title: 第一章：路口
chapters.text:
我住的小镇很安静。镇外有一条小路，路很窄，两边都是树。大家叫它“北边的路”。白天有人走过，可是很少。

我第一次听说这条路，是在食堂。一个同学小声说：“别一个人去那边。”我问他为什么，他只摇头，说：“去过的人，不会回来。”

我不信。我问老师，老师笑着说：“别想太多，回去学习。”我又问生活老师王老师，他看了我一眼，说：“不要问。”

第二天是星期六，我们不用上课。我和同学在操场玩儿，可是我一直在想那条路。中午以后，我一个人走到学校门口。门口有地图，地图上没有那条路。

我沿着围墙往北走，越走越安静。风吹过树叶，声音像有人在说话。路口有一块旧牌子，上面写着：禁止进入。可是牌子很破，好像很久没人管。

我站在路口，没有进去。我看见地上有一只小鞋子，干净得像刚放下。旁边还有一点白纸，上面只有两个字：回来。

我心里一冷，赶快把纸捡起来放进口袋。我回头看学校，学校就在那儿，可是我突然觉得离得很远。

晚上回到宿舍，我把那张纸拿出来。字还在，可是纸背面多了一个淡淡的手印。我正想再看清楚，灯突然闪了一下。

门外有人轻轻敲门。没有人说话，只听见一声很低的笑。

en_sentences.en: My town is very quiet.
Outside the town there is a small road. It is narrow, with trees on both sides.
Everyone calls it “the north road.”
People walk there in the daytime, but not many.
The first time I heard about this road was in the cafeteria.
A classmate whispered, “Don’t go over there alone.”
I asked why, but he only shook his head and said, “People who go there don’t come back.”
I didn’t believe it.
I asked a teacher. The teacher smiled and said, “Don’t think too much. Go back and study.”
I asked our life teacher, Teacher Wang. He glanced at me and said, “Don’t ask.”
The next day was Saturday, and we didn’t have class.
I played on the playground with classmates, but I kept thinking about that road.
After noon, I walked alone to the school gate.
At the gate there is a map, but that road isn’t on it.
I walked north along the wall. The farther I went, the quieter it became.
The wind moved through the leaves, and it sounded like someone was talking.
At the road entrance there was an old sign that said: No Entry.
But the sign was broken, like nobody had cared for it in a long time.
I stood at the entrance and didn’t go in.
I saw a small shoe on the ground, clean as if it had just been set down.
Next to it was a small piece of white paper with only two characters: “Come back.”
My heart went cold. I quickly picked up the paper and put it into my pocket.
I looked back at the school. It was right there, but suddenly it felt very far away.
That night in the dorm, I took the paper out.
The words were still there, but on the back was a faint handprint.
I was trying to see it clearly when the light suddenly flickered.
Someone gently knocked on the door.
No one spoke. I only heard a very quiet laugh.

chapters.title: 没有封面的书
chapters.text:
我在旧书店里发现一本没有封面的书。翻开第一页，里面写着：
    “如果你看到这行字，请把书带走。”
    
我抬头看了看四周，没有人。于是我买下它，走出门时，风把书页吹开，露出一张夹着的照片：
    照片里的人，竟然是我。

en_sentences.en: I found an old book without its cover in a used bookstore.
Opening the first page, it says: "If you're reading this line, please take the book with you."
I looked up and around, but there was no one.
So I bought it, and as I stepped out of the door, the wind blew open the book pages to reveal a photo tucked inside: The person in the photo was actually me.

chapters.title: 雨中的小咖啡店
chapters.text: 昨天我在雨中迷路，走进一家小咖啡店。老板笑着给我一杯热茶，说：“慢慢来，路会找到你。”我坐了一会儿，雨停了，心也安静了。

en_sentences.en: Yesterday, I got lost in the rain and stumbled upon a small coffee shop.
The boss smilingly handed me a cup of hot tea and said, "Take it slow, the road will find you."
I sat for a while, and then the rain stopped, my heart grew calm as well."

chapters.title: 懒猫Kiki的冒险
chapters.text:
Kiki是一只又胖又懒的猫，平时最爱睡觉和吃鱼。一天中午，它发现窗外有一只小鸟叼着闪闪发光的钥匙飞走了。Kiki本想继续睡，可好奇心推着它跳下窗台，慢慢跟了上去。
它穿过小巷，爬过矮墙，第一次跑得气喘吁吁。小鸟把钥匙掉在一棵老树下，Kiki叼起钥匙，发现树洞里藏着一盒温热的猫罐头。
Kiki吃得心满意足，拖着钥匙回家，从此每天仍然很懒，但心里多了一点：原来世界，也会奖励一次小小的勇敢。

en_sentences.en: Kiki is a plump and lazy cat who loves sleeping and eating fish.
One midday, it discovered that outside the window, there was a small bird flying away with a shiny key in its beak.
Kiki wanted to keep sleeping, but curiosity pushed it to jump down from the windowsill and slowly follow along.
It dashed through the alley, climbed over the low wall for the first time, breathlessly panting.
A little bird dropped its key under an old tree, and Kiki picked it up. Upon examining the hollow of the tree, she found a warm can of cat food hidden there.

Kiki ate to her heart's content and dragged her key back home, whereupon she remained as lazy as ever every day thereafter. But inside, there was a new addition: she knew that the world could reward even the smallest act of bravery.
